Subject: RE: Closure of Al Ain - Insurance Claim - Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - GIG / Policy# 13/FA/33913/0/41 - Nasco Claim# 66-FIR-2024-02-000024 

 

Dear Nasser,

 

Thank you for following up on this matter.

 

The primary reason for the extended timeline is that this claim affected four different locations (Carolina Herrera, L'Occitane, Swarovski, and Penhaligon's Kiosk) falling under three separate entities and with a business interruption element. This has required extensive coordination and documentation from multiple parties.

 

Current status:

*	We are in the final stages of wrapping up the claim.
*	We're coordinating directly with the surveyor to finalize the claim and issue the final report.
*	The only remaining item is the financial validation documents from Carolina Herrera (CH). We're actively pursuing this to close the file. 

I understand the importance of resolving this matter promptly and will push to close it within this week.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop Ghazarian

Dear Hagop,

 

In order to progress the matters with the below referenced premises, please provide the following in relation to denial of access: 

 

1.	Copies of any and all correspondence between the mall owner and your team, both in formal notices and any email correspondence

 

In case you wish to submit a Business Interruption claim for consideration for Loss of Profits etc., loss adjuster will require the following initial details: 

 

No.

Description

1

Detailed summary of impact on business operations (i.e. dates and duration of interruption, specific areas of the business affected etc.)

2

Details of any mitigation plan implemented to avoid or limit turnover losses

3

Copies of Annual Financial Statements for the last three years prior to the damage/incident, including Detailed Income Statement if not incorporated

4

Monthly Management Accounts for the two years prior to the incident as well as the entire interruption period

5

Turnover history covering the period of the last two financial years plus any period subsequent thereto up to the date of damage/incident (by month)

6

Formulated claim of the Insured’s loss of gross profit and/or increase in cost of working as a direct result of the incident setting out the following:

6.1

Projected Turnover by month for the 12 month period following the incident (on the assumption no incident occurred)

6.2

Details of actual and lost turnover by month for the interruption period

Subject: FW: Closure of Al Ain - Insurance Claim Advice

 

Dear Hagop

 

I hope all is well? I was pointed in your direction and I am hoping you can advise accordingly

 

We received a notice from Al Ain Mall that it is closed until further notice due to the weather – there was no damage to our store or stock. This is for Swarovski

 

We need to seek compensation for business interruption, we are missing a key trading period of Valentines Day – we are also running the risk of missing the Ramadan trading period if its closed for a prolonged period of time.

 

Please may you advise next steps we need to take? If this does not sit in your scope, please could you point me in the direction of who could help us

 

Cc @Nasser Alblooshi <mailto:Nasser.Alblooshi@chalhoub.com>  for visibility as it may impact more stores within the network and not just Swarovski
